alert.note: Alert for Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 11 at 3:42AM HST until January 12 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU, KAUAI, OAHU, MOLOKAI, NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI, AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .Warning-level surf along exposed north and west facing shores is expected into Wednesday as a west-northwest swell arrives and moves through. Surf should lower to advisory levels late Wednesday. ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Surf building to 8 to 12 feet this afternoon. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Surf will build through the day today with a peak likely occurring later this afternoon through tonight. A gradual downward trend is expected by late Wednesday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across portions of beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore and rip currents. Breaking waves may occasionally impact harbors making navigating the harbor channel dangerous.
info.instruction: Large, breaking surf, significant shorebreak, and dangerous currents make entering the water very hazardous.
